title: 820-2915 graphics problem
message: [FONT=arial][SIZE=14px]Board had the GPU replaced about 2 years ago and worked fine till now, when it came in and it had the typical GPU issues so I replaced the GPU with the same [LEFT][COLOR=#011F36]216-0810084, this time the computer booted up but some areas of the image show lines and weird colors, I then put a new-other GPU and same issue, I also replaced C9560 but I am stil getting 1.3v on [/COLOR][/LEFT][COLOR=#0b0354]PP1V5_GPU_REG, any pointers will be appreciated.[/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT]

title: 820-2915 graphics problem
message:
C9560 is not a problem in this board.
And 1.35V is correct voltage for vRAM.

Same issue on external monitor?
Could be now bad solders/traces under vRAM chips.

Is almost impossible to get real "NEW" chip for these; better to disable GPU...

title: 820-2915 graphics problem
message:
I just got about 4 of this Macs from people who don't have money to buy new computers and they want me to fix them even by disabling the GPU, so far I am successful doing this with 820-2915-B by following this steps:
[LIST]
[*]Doing this will disable external image to a monitor 
[*]Adjusting brightness can only be done via software with an App called QuickShade and a version compatible with 10.13 or below, the current one in the App store wont work.
[/LIST]
[LIST=1]
[*]Set LCD_BKLT_PWM (R9704) to 3v with jumper from PP3V3_S0 (R5650), this solves problem when opening lid shows no image. 
[*]Remove R8911 to remove power to GPU 
[*]Load modified BIOS to disable GPU 
[*]Select a startup disk 
[*]Add a firmware password “GPU” so an SMC reset won’t disable this "hack"
[/LIST]

Now on boards 820-2915-A those same steps wont work, any pointers will be greatly appreciated.

title: 820-2915 graphics problem
message: I know that there is the Tiresias (the GPUkiller)  that makes this easier, but I am trying to see if I can get away by doing it just with changing hardware configuration and changing BIOS.

title: 820-2915 graphics problem
message:
I never looked at A/B board version.
I did maybe 10 in this way.
Few months ago I started to do it reflashing GMUX.
